title: Coronation Street cast stuck in downpour as they film in the rain
text:
Bill Roache sheltered himself from the downpour on set (Picture: MCPIX)

The cast of Coronation Street braved the bad weather as they filmed scenes in a downpour.

The actors were on location in Manchester when the sky opened up.

But the show must go on and the soap stars made their way through the heavy rain by covering up with large coats and umbrellas.

Actor Bill Roache, who plays Ken Barlow, gamely got to work with a blue waterproof over his head.

He was joined on set by a handful of his co-stars including Lisa George (Beth), Sally Dyvenor (Sally), Alison King (Carla) Sam Aston (Chesney) and Colson Smith (Craig).

Andy Whyment (Kirk), Chris Gascoigne and Rob Mallard (Daniel) were also there on the day walking through the driving rain holding coats over themselves.

It comes as the Met Office issued a Yellow warning for Greater Manchester, with heavy rain causing road closures and flooding recently.

However according to Manchester Evening News, things are set to ease off over the weekend.

All the cast members were suited and booted for the scenes, with many wearing a colourful brooch pinned on their clothes.

Actor Daniel Brocklebank, who plays Billy on the show, was also on location wearing Billy’s vicar’s dog collar and shirt, suggesting that whatever was being filmed takes place in a church.

As star Kym Marsh (Michelle) was recently spotted filming in a wedding dress ahead of her exit from the soap, it’s possible that Michelle’s big day was continuing.

However given the recent, sad death of Sinead (Katie McGlynn) on the show, and the presence of the entire Barlow family on set, there’s a chance that this could be the first look at scenes from Sinead’s funeral.

It could go some way to explaining why many cast members were wearing brooches, as a likely tribute to the factory worker.

Or given that Chesney and Gemma (Dolly-Rose Campbell) want to make a proper go of things, maybe we’re looking at the first scenes from their big day? Sam Aston is looking very smiley after all…

Following Sinead tragic death, leaving behind Daniel and their baby son Bertie, upcoming episodes will see Daniel struggle to organise the funeral.

Wanting to get away from the Street for a while, Daniel announces to his family that he is going to take Bertie to Scotland for a while for a break.
